p: Stem bark of Kigelia africana was collected from Kakamega tropical rain forest, in Kakamega county (0.2919 o N 34.8561 o E), Kenya in January 2018. Plant identification and authentication was done by Simon Njiru, a botanist at Kenya Institute of Organic Farming and a sample specimen deposited at the University of Embu herbarium (voucher number UoE-KA-2018).
